data.title: Great meal under ten bucks
data.text: Was in Pittsburgh 3 days on business with a per diem limit.  This was the best meal we had in all 3 days.  Quick service and tasty food.

data.title: Average Qdoba
data.text: Nothing spectacular,  but for something different it was good.  Tacos had more than enough stuff on them.  And the bowl was good as well  They do have the super Coke machine that gives you a hundred different flavors.

data.title: Food was good but they make billing errors
data.text: I have been there twice and ordered same food both the days. Billing was completely different for the same food. I figured out that I was charged right on the first day and then on the second day, when I got to know I have an employee discount of 10%, I was charged even more. I did not notice since I did not get any receipt until I left the city the other day.

data.title: below average food
data.text: Had moved to pittsburgh from NY, since there are hardly any places for indian food around US Steel plaza, had to explore this. Not worth and no where close to mexican. If you are a chipotle fan you can easily skip this place.

data.title: The best Qdoba around!
data.text:
I may have possibly visited this qdoba more times than any human being period, until recent months when my company moved out of downtown.  Some weeks I'd go 3 or 4 times for lunch.  

Downtown it's not all that uncommon to learn your customer's names, as they become regulars, but you know it's next level when you start knowing the employees names  - when they don't have name tags.  

Joy and the team truly take care of business, even when she's having a horrible day and I talk to her, she's still just as friendly, as is the rest of the staff.  (If she reads this she'll remember me and my blue Nike hat.)  

Probably only about 1% of the time was my order ever wrong and I was too polite to say anything.  There have been days where I forgot my wallet, they knew I'd be back the next day to pay - they're good reasonable people.  

Employees make eye contact and even though they've dealt with 200 other people before you, you feel like they've been waiting to see you and help you, personally.

Food is done correctly, ripped burritos are redone without asking.  Soft taco shells are steamed lightly and guacamole is added FIRST to your taco, rather than last - because they know that when you put in on top of the lettuce, it gets everywhere.  They truly understand what they're doing and how they're doing it.  I've asked for guac before that was not from the greatest avocados and they refused to give it to me - because they knew it was sub par that day.  

Never ever had cause to return food, no hairs, no tomato cores, no chicken bones - attention to detail.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: The food is yummy.  It is a great place to go for lunch if you don't have alot of time.  They are quick and friendly.
